etymologies: late 18th century (in the sense ‘in agreement or harmony’): from French, literally ‘in sequence’

definitions: (of a bathroom) immediately adjoining a bedroom and forming part of the same set of rooms
shortDefinitions: immediately adjoining bedroom and forming part of same set of rooms

definitions: (of a bedroom) having an adjoining bathroom that forms part of the same set of rooms

examples.text: there are twenty-five luxurious en suite bedrooms
all rooms are en suite with color TV

definitions: (with reference to a bathroom) so as to form part of the same set of rooms as a bedroom

examples.text: each bedroom has a small bathroom en suite

shortDefinitions: so as to form part of same set of rooms as bedroom

definitions: a bathroom that immediately adjoins a bedroom and forms part of the same set of rooms

examples.text: the en suite is fully tiled in black and white and has a double shower
